conclusion: For motion with constant acceleration the kinematic relation is v² = u² + 2 a x, where u is the initial speed, v the instantaneous speed, a the (constant) acceleration and x the displacement.
Rearranging the kinematic relation gives a = (v² – u²) / (2 x).
In a graph of v² versus x, the straight-line slope equals 2 a.
In the given figure, the line corresponding to Car A is steeper than that for Car B at every point shown.
Therefore 2 a_A > 2 a_B and hence a_A > a_B.
Car A has the greater acceleration.
